name: The Association of Corporate Treasurers
legal: A body established in England by Royal Charter
goal:
The Association of Corporate Treasurers (ACT) is the chartered body for treasury, the only professional treasury association with a Royal Charter.
We set the global benchmark for treasury excellence and lead the profession through our internationally recognised qualifications, by defining standards and championing continuing professional development.
We are the authentic voice of the treasury profession representing the interests of the real economy and educating, supporting and leading the treasurers of today and tomorrow.

Membership is by examination. Our 7,000+ members and students work in companies of all sizes through industry, commerce and professional services.

Guidelines about our approach to policy and technical matters are available at http://www.treasurers.org/technical/manifesto
interests: Economic and Financial Affairs, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Internal Market
euInitiatives: The ACT is involved in making representations on matters that impact upon companies and their treasury, risk and corporate finance activities, including banking regulation and the regulation of financial markets.  Examples of particular relevance include  the regulation of Credit Rating Agencies, the regulation of money market funds, the structure of future banking regulation, the regulation of OTC derivative markets (EMIR) and the Prospectus Directive.
